verses.verse: To the chief Musician<WH5329>, A Psalm of David<WH1732>, the servant<WH5650> of the LORD<WH3068>, who spake<WH1696> unto the LORD<WH3068> the words<WH1697> of this song<WH7892> in the day<WH3117> that the LORD<WH3068> delivered<WH5337> him from the hand<WH3709> of all his enemies<WH341>, and from the hand<WH3027> of Saul<WH7586>: And he said<WH559>, I will love<WH7355> thee, O LORD<WH3068>, my strength<WH2391>.

The LORD<WH3068> is my rock<WH5553>, and my fortress<WH4686>, and my deliverer<WH6403>; my God<WH410>, my strength<WH6697>, in whom I will trust<WH2620>; my buckler<WH4043>, and the horn<WH7161> of my salvation<WH3468>, and my high tower<WH4869>. my strength: Heb. my rock
I will call<WH7121> upon the LORD<WH3068>, who is worthy to be praised<WH1984>: so shall I be saved<WH3467> from mine enemies<WH341>.
The sorrows<WH2256> of death<WH4194> compassed<WH661> me, and the floods<WH5158> of ungodly men<WH1100> made me afraid<WH1204>. ungodly men: Heb. Belial
The sorrows<WH2256> of hell<WH7585> compassed me about<WH5437>: the snares<WH4170> of death<WH4194> prevented<WH6923> me. sorrows: or, cords

In my distress<WH6862> I called<WH7121> upon the LORD<WH3068>, and cried<WH7768> unto my God<WH430>: he heard<WH8085> my voice<WH6963> out of his temple<WH1964>, and my cry<WH7775> came<WH935> before<WH6440> him, even into his ears<WH241>.
Then the earth<WH776> shook<WH1607> and trembled<WH7493>; the foundations<WH4146> also of the hills<WH2022> moved<WH7264> and were shaken<WH1607>, because he was wroth<WH2734>.

There went up<WH5927> a smoke<WH6227> out of his nostrils<WH639>, and fire<WH784> out of his mouth<WH6310> devoured<WH398>: coals<WH1513> were kindled<WH1197> by it. out of his nostrils: Heb. by his, etc
He bowed<WH5186> the heavens<WH8064> also, and came down<WH3381>: and darkness<WH6205> was under his feet<WH7272>.
And he rode<WH7392> upon a cherub<WH3742>, and did fly<WH5774>: yea, he did fly<WH1675> upon the wings<WH3671> of the wind<WH7307>.
He made<WH7896> darkness<WH2822> his secret place<WH5643>; his pavilion<WH5521> round about<WH5439> him were dark<WH2824> waters<WH4325> and thick clouds<WH5645> of the skies<WH7834>.
At the brightness<WH5051> that was before him his thick clouds<WH5645> passed<WH5674>, hail<WH1259> stones and coals<WH1513> of fire<WH784>.
The LORD<WH3068> also thundered<WH7481> in the heavens<WH8064>, and the Highest<WH5945> gave<WH5414> his voice<WH6963>; hail<WH1259> stones and coals<WH1513> of fire<WH784>.
Yea, he sent out<WH7971> his arrows<WH2671>, and scattered<WH6327> them; and he shot out<WH7232> lightnings<WH1300>, and discomfited<WH2000> them.

Then the channels<WH650> of waters<WH4325> were seen<WH7200>, and the foundations<WH4146> of the world<WH8398> were discovered<WH1540> at thy rebuke<WH1606>, O LORD<WH3068>, at the blast<WH5397> of the breath<WH7307> of thy nostrils<WH639>.
He sent<WH7971> from above<WH4791>, he took<WH3947> me, he drew<WH4871> me out of many<WH7227> waters<WH4325>. many: or, great
He delivered<WH5337> me from my strong<WH5794> enemy<WH341>, and from them which hated<WH8130> me: for they were too strong<WH553> for me.
They prevented<WH6923> me in the day<WH3117> of my calamity<WH343>: but the LORD<WH3068> was my stay<WH4937>.
He brought me forth<WH3318> also into a large place<WH4800>; he delivered<WH2502> me, because he delighted<WH2654> in me.
The LORD<WH3068> rewarded<WH1580> me according to my righteousness<WH6664>; according to the cleanness<WH1252> of my hands<WH3027> hath he recompensed<WH7725> me.
For I have kept<WH8104> the ways<WH1870> of the LORD<WH3068>, and have not wickedly departed<WH7561> from my God<WH430>.
For all his judgments<WH4941> were before me, and I did not put away<WH5493> his statutes<WH2708> from me.
I was also upright<WH8549> before him, and I kept<WH8104> myself from mine iniquity<WH5771>. before: Heb. with
Therefore hath the LORD<WH3068> recompensed<WH7725> me according to my righteousness<WH6664>, according to the cleanness<WH1252> of my hands<WH3027> in his eyesight<WH5869>. in: Heb. before his eyes
With the merciful<WH2623> thou wilt shew thyself merciful<WH2616>; with an upright<WH8549> man<WH1399> thou wilt shew thyself upright<WH8552>;
With the pure<WH1305> thou wilt shew thyself pure<WH1305>; and with the froward<WH6141> thou wilt shew thyself froward<WH6617>. shew thyself froward: or, wrestle
For thou wilt save<WH3467> the afflicted<WH6041> people<WH5971>; but wilt bring down<WH8213> high<WH7311> looks<WH5869>.
For thou wilt light<WH215> my candle<WH5216>: the LORD<WH3068> my God<WH430> will enlighten<WH5050> my darkness<WH2822>. candle: or, lamp
For by thee I have run through<WH7323> a troop<WH1416>; and by my God<WH430> have I leaped over<WH1801> a wall<WH7791>. run: or, broken
As for God<WH410>, his way<WH1870> is perfect<WH8549>: the word<WH565> of the LORD<WH3068> is tried<WH6884>: he is a buckler<WH4043> to all those that trust<WH2620> in him. tried: or, refined
For who is God<WH433> save<WH1107> the LORD<WH3068>? or who is a rock<WH6697> save<WH2108> our God<WH430>?
It is God<WH410> that girdeth<WH247> me with strength<WH2428>, and maketh<WH5414> my way<WH1870> perfect<WH8549>.
He maketh<WH7737> my feet<WH7272> like hinds'<WH355> feet, and setteth<WH5975> me upon my high places<WH1116>.
He teacheth<WH3925> my hands<WH3027> to war<WH4421>, so that a bow<WH7198> of steel<WH5154> is broken<WH5181> by mine arms<WH2220>.

Thou hast also given<WH5414> me the shield<WH4043> of thy salvation<WH3468>: and thy right hand<WH3225> hath holden me up<WH5582>, and thy gentleness<WH6037> hath made me great<WH7235>. thy gentleness: or, with thy meekness thou hast multiplied me
Thou hast enlarged<WH7337> my steps<WH6806> under me, that my feet<WH7166> did not slip<WH4571>. my feet: Heb. mine ankles
I have pursued<WH7291> mine enemies<WH341>, and overtaken<WH5381> them: neither did I turn again<WH7725> till they were consumed<WH3615>.
I have wounded<WH4272> them that they were not able<WH3201> to rise<WH6965>: they are fallen<WH5307> under my feet<WH7272>.
For thou hast girded<WH247> me with strength<WH2428> unto the battle<WH4421>: thou hast subdued<WH3766> under me those that rose up<WH6965> against me. subdued: Heb. caused to bow
Thou hast also given<WH5414> me the necks<WH6203> of mine enemies<WH341>; that I might destroy<WH6789> them that hate<WH8130> me.
They cried<WH7768>, but there was none to save<WH3467> them: even unto the LORD<WH3068>, but he answered<WH6030> them not.
Then did I beat<WH7833> them small as the dust<WH6083> before<WH6440> the wind<WH7307>: I did cast them out<WH7324> as the dirt<WH2916> in the streets<WH2351>.

Thou hast delivered<WH6403> me from the strivings<WH7379> of the people<WH5971>; and thou hast made<WH7760> me the head<WH7218> of the heathen<WH1471>: a people<WH5971> whom I have not known<WH3045> shall serve<WH5647> me.

As soon as they hear<WH8088> <WH241> of me, they shall obey<WH8085> me: the strangers<WH1121> <WH5236> shall submit<WH3584> themselves unto me. As soon: Heb. At the hearing of the ear submit: or, yield feigned obedience strangers: Heb. sons of the stranger
The strangers<WH1121> <WH5236> shall fade away<WH5034>, and be afraid<WH2727> out of their close places<WH4526>. strangers: Heb. sons of the stranger
The LORD<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>; and blessed<WH1288> be my rock<WH6697>; and let the God<WH430> of my salvation<WH3468> be exalted<WH7311>.
It is God<WH410> that avengeth<WH5414> <WH5360> me, and subdueth<WH1696> the people<WH5971> under me. avengeth: Heb. giveth avengements for subdueth: or, destroyeth

He delivereth<WH6403> me from mine enemies<WH341>: yea, thou liftest me up<WH7311> above those that rise up<WH6965> against me: thou hast delivered<WH5337> me from the violent<WH2555> man<WH376>. violent: Heb. man of violence
Therefore will I give thanks<WH3034> unto thee, O LORD<WH3068>, among the heathen<WH1471>, and sing praises<WH2167> unto thy name<WH8034>. give: or, confess
Great<WH1431> deliverance<WH3444> giveth he to his king<WH4428>; and sheweth<WH6213> mercy<WH2617> to his anointed<WH4899>, to David<WH1732>, and to his seed<WH2233> for<WH5704> evermore<WH5769>.
